titles.title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 2262) to modify the requirements applicable to locatable minerals on public domain lands, consistent with the principles of self-initiation of mining claims, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 110-416, by Mr. McGovern.

All points of order against consideration of the bill are waived except those arising under clause 9 or 10 of rule XXI. It shall be in order to consider as an original bill for the purpose of amendment under the five-minute rule the amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on Natural Resources now printed in the bill.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 142.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 780.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 221 - 194 (Roll no. 1027).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 224 - 195 (Roll no. 1028).

bill.summary: 11/1/2007--Passed House without amendment. Sets forth the rule for consideration of H.R. 2262 (Hardrock Mining and Reclamation Act of 2007).
